meta.name: Gone with the Wind
meta.description: A sheltered and manipulative Southern belle and a roguish profiteer face off in a turbulent romance as the society around them crumbles with the end of slavery and is rebuilt during the Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

review.name: Even after years of being made.. it is good!
review.reviewBody:
I wish people made more movies like this nowadays..

Yes! The movie is LONG, but the development of the main character has you swinging from liking her to hating her, to agreeing with her, to.. all sort of emotions!! It is well worth anyone's time. These characters feel SO real! It's like a perfect summarized soap opera. Anyone studying movie-writing should check this adaptation of the book. Would recommend to anyone.

And make yourself a favor and don't watch the sequel.. the movie ends the way it does for a reason.

description.value: On this IMDbrief, we celebrate four unsung Black heroes of film history and four films to watch to get to know them better.

text.plaidHtml: Hattie McDaniel became the first Black person to be nominated for - and win - an Academy Award.
After Ashley Wilkes is carried into his room from a night at Belle's place, Melanie picks up a lamp with an electric cord attached.

lines.text: Rhett, Rhett... Rhett, if you go, where shall I go? What shall I do?
Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.

text.plaidHtml:
Opening credits prologue: There was a land of Cavaliers and Cotton Fields called the Old South...
Here in this pretty world Gallantry took its last bow..
Here was the last ever to be seen of Knights and their Ladies Fair, of Master and Slave...
Look for it only in books, for it is no more than a dream remembered.
A Civilization gone with the wind...
When originally released theatrically in the UK in 1940, the BBFC made cuts to secure a 'A' rating.
